## Monitoring Species Population in Different Habitats

```{r,comment=""}
# Define population counts for each habitat
habitat_A_population <- 320
habitat_B_population <- 275

# Calculate the total population across both habitats
total_population <- habitat_A_population + habitat_B_population

# Check if Habitat A has a larger population than Habitat B
is_habitat_A_larger <- habitat_A_population > habitat_B_population

# Compute the difference in population between the two habitats
population_difference <- habitat_A_population - habitat_B_population

# Display results
print(paste("Habitat A population:", habitat_A_population))
print(paste("Habitat B population:", habitat_B_population))
print(paste("Total population:", total_population))
print(paste("Is Habitat A larger than Habitat B?", is_habitat_A_larger))
print(paste("Population difference:", population_difference))

```

## Analyzing Environmental Data for Climate Change Impact

```{r, comment=""}
# Set the current temperature and predicted increase (in °C)
current_temperature <- 25
predicted_increase <- 3.8

# Calculate future temperature (in °C)
future_temperature <- current_temperature + predicted_increase

# Convert current and future temperatures to Fahrenheit
current_temperature_F <- (current_temperature * 9/5) + 32
future_temperature_F <- (future_temperature * 9/5) + 32

# Check if future temperature exceeds threshold 
exceeds_threshold <- future_temperature > 5

# Display results
print(paste("Current temperature (C):", current_temperature))
print(paste("Predicted increase (C):", predicted_increase))
print(paste("Future temperature (C):", future_temperature))
print(paste("Current temperature (F):", current_temperature_F))
print(paste("Future temperature (F):", future_temperature_F))
print(paste("Does future temperature exceed critical threshold?", exceeds_threshold))

```

## Evaluating Pollutant Levels in a River

```{r, comment=""}
# Set chemical concentrations in parts per million (ppm)
chemical_X_concentration <- 15.3
chemical_Y_concentration <- 9.8

# Check if each chemical is within safe limits (assumed threshold = 10 ppm)
is_chemical_X_safe <- chemical_X_concentration < 10
is_chemical_Y_safe <- chemical_Y_concentration < 10

# Determine if both chemicals are within safe limits
are_both_safe <- is_chemical_X_safe & is_chemical_Y_safe

# Display results
print(paste("Chemical X concentration (ppm):", chemical_X_concentration))
print(paste("Chemical Y concentration (ppm):", chemical_Y_concentration))
print(paste("Is Chemical X safe?", is_chemical_X_safe))
print(paste("Is Chemical Y safe?", is_chemical_Y_safe))
print(paste("Are both chemicals safe?", are_both_safe))

```
